content: You have been granted access to the {{itemName}} document. Click the link below to open the document right now: {{shareLink}}.

comment.text: This translation key is used to display a notification email body when sharing a document externally. It will be inserted into an email template and includes a link to open the shared document.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The colon (:) after 'Click the link' is missing in the Azerbaijani translation.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Sizə {{itemName}} sənədinə giriş icazəsi verildi. Sənədi hazırda açmaq üçün aşağıdakı linki klikləyin: {{shareLink}}.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'You have been granted access' is not accurately translated. 'Даден Ви е достъп' is a literal translation but sounds somewhat formal and less natural in Bulgarian. A more natural phrasing would be 'Имате достъп до'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Имате достъп до документ {{itemName}}

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrasing "Kliknutím na níže uvedený odkaz dokument právě teď otevřete" is grammatically awkward. It's a passive construction that doesn't flow naturally in Czech.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Kliknutím na níže uvedený odkaz můžete dokument hned otevřít.  (Clicking the link below, you can open the document right now.)

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'právě' in 'dokument právě teď otevřete' is redundant and doesn't add meaning in this context.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Remove 'právě' from the sentence. The suggested correction removes it entirely.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "You have been granted access" is better translated as something more formal like "Es wurde Ihnen Zugriff gewährt" or "Sie haben Zugriff erhalten". The current translation 'Ihnen wurde Zugriff erteilt' is technically correct, but sounds slightly awkward in a formal context.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Es wurde Ihnen Zugriff auf das Dokument {{itemName}} gewährt.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The original English uses 'Click the link below'. A more natural German equivalent would be 'Klicken Sie auf den Link'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Klicken Sie auf den Link:

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Greek translation uses a colon (:) after 'τώρα' which is grammatically correct but can be more natural if replaced with a period (.) for consistency with typical email body formatting.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Κάντε κλικ στον παρακάτω σύνδεσμο για να ανοίξετε το έγγραφο τώρα .

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'granted access' is better translated as 'accorder l'accès' or 'autoriser l'accès'. 'Autorisé à accéder' is somewhat redundant.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Vous avez été autorisé à accéder au document {{itemName}}.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "տրվել է մատչում դեպի" is not a natural or accurate translation of "granted access to". It sounds awkward and doesn't convey the intended meaning. A more accurate translation would use a phrase like "տրվել է դostęp" (given access) or "ունեցել եք մատչի իրավունք" (you have access rights).
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ձեզ տրվել է դostęp դեպի {{itemName}} փաստաթուղթ

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The space before and after the variable `{{itemName}}` is a little awkward. While not a critical error, consistency in spacing improves readability.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ձեզ տրվել է մատչում դեպի{{itemName}} փաստաթուղթ

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Italian translation uses a colon after 'documento' which creates an unusual sentence structure in Italian. A period is more natural.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ti è stato concesso l'accesso al documento {{itemName}}. Fare clic sul collegamento sottostante per aprire subito il documento: {{shareLink}}.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: Repetitive phrasing: The phrase '{{shareLink}}をクリックしてください' is redundant, as '以下のリンクをクリックして' already implies clicking the link.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: あなたは{{itemName}}ドキュメントへのアクセスを許可されています。以下のリンクをクリックして、今すぐドキュメントを開いてください: {{shareLink}}。

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "여세요" (yeoseyo) is an unusual and potentially incorrect translation of "open". A more natural and common way to express 'open' in this context would be "열어보세요" (yeolloboseyo).
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Change "여세요" to "열어보세요".

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'document' is translated as 'ເອກະສານ' which is correct, but it is repeated. It might be better to use a synonym or rephrase to avoid repetition.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider rephrasing to avoid repetition. For example: 'ທ່ານໄດ້ຮັບອະນຸຍາດເຂົ້າເຖິງເອກະສານ {{itemName}}. ກົດທີ່ລິ້ງດ້ານລຸ່ມເພື່ອເປີດມັນດຽວນີ້: {{shareLink}}.'

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While grammatically correct, the phrasing 'ເອກະສານດຽວນີ້' (document now) sounds slightly unnatural in Lao. It's more common to simply say 'ເອກະສານນີ້' (this document).
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Change 'ເອກະສານດຽວນີ້' to 'ເອກະສານນີ້'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'tūlīt atvērtu dokumentu' could be improved for a more natural flow. While technically correct, it sounds slightly awkward in Latvian.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Jums ir piešķirta piekļuve dokumentam {{itemName}}. Noklikšķiniet uz tālāk esošās saites, lai atvērtu dokumentu: {{shareLink}}.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "Foi-lhe concedido acesso" can sound overly formal and stiff in many contexts. A more natural and common phrasing would be "Você recebeu acesso" or "Você tem acesso".
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Você recebeu acesso ao documento {{itemName}}.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "agora mesmo" translates to 'right now' but may be perceived as slightly too emphatic and informal in certain contexts. A softer phrasing could be considered.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Clique na ligação abaixo para abrir o documento: {{shareLink}}.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "Foi-lhe concedido acesso" is overly formal and not commonly used in Brazilian Portuguese. It translates to 'You were granted access' in a very formal way.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Use a more natural phrasing like "Você recebeu acesso ao" or "Você tem acesso ao".

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'agora mesmo' while technically correct, can sound a little emphatic and slightly unnatural in this context. A more natural and common phrasing would be better.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Replace 'agora mesmo' with 'agora' or simply omit it.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Romanian translation uses 'ca să' instead of a more formal 'pentru a' before 'deschideți'. While 'ca să' is common in spoken Romanian, 'pentru a' is more appropriate for formal communication like this.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: V-a fost acordat accesul la document {{itemName}}. Faceți clic pe link-ul de mai jos pentru a deschideți documentul chiar acum: {{shareLink}}.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "ඔබට ... ප්‍රවේශය ලබා දී ඇත" is a slightly formal way of saying 'You have been granted access'. A more natural and common phrasing would be 'ඔබට ... වෙත ප්‍රවේශය ඇත' or 'ඔබට ... භාවිතා කිරීමට අවසර ඇත'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ඔබට {{itemName}} ලේඛනය වෙත ප්‍රවේශය ඇත. (or)  ඔබට {{itemName}} ලේඛනය භාවිතා කිරීමට අවසර ඇත.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The colon (:) after 'ඔබන්න' in 'පහත සබැඳිය ඔබන්න:' can be stylistically improved. While not incorrect, it can sound slightly abrupt. A softer tone might be preferred.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: පහත සබැඳිය ක්ලික් කරන්න: (or) පහත සබැඳිය ක්ලික් කරන්න.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Slovak translation uses 'Kliknutím na odkaz nižšie otvoríte dokument hneď teraz'. While grammatically correct, it sounds slightly formal and less natural. A more conversational approach would be better.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Kliknite na odkaz nižšie a dokument sa otvorí hneď.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The placement of the colon (:) after 'hneď teraz' is not ideal. It breaks the flow.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Remove the colon after 'hneď teraz' or rephrase the sentence to avoid it.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'You have been granted access' is not accurately translated. 'Omogočen vam je dostop' is a more literal translation of 'access is enabled for you,' but doesn't convey the meaning of being granted access. A more natural translation would be something like 'Imate dostop' or 'Dobili ste dostop'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Imate dostop do {{itemName}} dokumenta. / Dobili ste dostop do {{itemName}} dokumenta.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English sentence uses a colon to introduce the link explanation. The Slovenian translation uses a period. While not strictly incorrect, maintaining the colon would improve consistency and readability.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Omogočen vam je dostop do {{itemName}} dokumenta. Če želite dokument odpreti, kliknite spodnjo povezavo:

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word "документу" should be "документу". While understandable, the ending is not quite right for the context.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: документу

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'да отворите документ одмах' could be more natural. While technically correct, it feels slightly awkward.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: да одмах отворите документ

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English phrase 'You have been granted access' is better translated to Serbian as 'Imate pristup' rather than 'Dobili ste pristup'. While 'Dobili ste pristup' isn't *wrong*, it implies a more active granting of access, whereas 'Imate pristup' is a more neutral and accurate representation.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Imate pristup dokumentu {{itemName}}.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Ukrainian translation lacks a period at the end of the first sentence. While not strictly incorrect, it is standard to include a period in this context.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Вам надано доступ до документа {{itemName}}. Клацніть посилання нижче, щоб відкрити документ зараз: {{shareLink}}.
